title: Mag 7 earnings, election volatility, bitcoin: Market Takeaways
describe: As US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) are looking ahead to next week's lineup — the 2024 presidential election and the Federal Reserve's November FOMC meeting — let's look back on some of the day's biggest market trends. Yahoo Finance markets and data editor Jared Blikre comes on Asking for a Trend to recap the five-day moving average on the megacap tech stocks that reported earnings this week — including the Magnificent Seven's Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Meta Platforms (META), and Microsoft (MSFT). He also monitors pre-election volatility's (^VIX) influence on Treasury yields (^TYX, ^TNX, ^FVX), and bitcoin's (BTC-USD) year-to-date pullback as it rallies ahead of the election and flirts with staying above its $70,000 benchmark. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

title: Intel price target raised to $26 from $25 at Truist
describe: Truist analyst William Stein raised the firm’s price target on Intel (INTC) to $26 from $25 and keeps a Hold rating on the shares. The company delivered a “beat and raise” Q3 result / Q4 guide, though its one-time charges are becoming “more elaborate and confusing” in both the near and longer-term, the analyst tells investors in a research note. Truist is also cutting its FY25 EPS view on Intel by 28c to $1.12. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving breaking

title: Uber's Q3 Review: Analysts See Opportunity Amid Growth Slowdown, Strong Margins, And Expanding Autonomous Vehicle Partnerships
describe: As US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) are looking ahead to next week's lineup — the 2024 presidential election and the Federal Reserve's November FOMC meeting — let's look back on some of the day's biggest market trends. Yahoo Finance markets and data editor Jared Blikre comes on Asking for a Trend to recap the five-day moving average on the megacap tech stocks that reported earnings this week — including the Magnificent Seven's Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Meta Platforms (META), and Microsoft (MSFT). He also monitors pre-election volatility's (^VIX) influence on Treasury yields (^TYX, ^TNX, ^FVX), and bitcoin's (BTC-USD) year-to-date pullback as it rallies ahead of the election and flirts with staying above its $70,000 benchmark. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

title: Intel Says It Won't Even Make $500M From Gaudi AI Chips In 2024 Despite Nvidia Minting Billions: CEO Gelsinger Says Uptake 'Slower Than We Anticipated'
describe: Truist analyst William Stein raised the firm’s price target on Intel (INTC) to $26 from $25 and keeps a Hold rating on the shares. The company delivered a “beat and raise” Q3 result / Q4 guide, though its one-time charges are becoming “more elaborate and confusing” in both the near and longer-term, the analyst tells investors in a research note.
